description: From Middle French élégiaque, from Latin elegīacus, from Ancient Greek ἐλεγειακός (elegeiakós).

adjectives.description: elegiac (comparative more elegiac, superlative most elegiac)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to an elegy.
examples: the elegiac distich or couplet, consisting of a dactylic hexameter and pentameter

entries.meaning: A poem composed in the couplet style of classical elegies: a line of dactylic hexameter followed by a line of dactylic pentameter.
